cycloneMessage.issuingUnit: NWS NATIONAL HURRICANE CENTER MIAMI FL
cycloneMessage.systemGeoRefPt1: ABOUT 800 MI...1285 KM SW OF THE SOUTHERN TIP OF BAJA CALIFORNIA
cycloneMessage.message:
ZCZC MIATCPEP2 ALL TTAA00 KNHC DDHHMM
BULLETIN Tropical Storm Greg Advisory Number 16 NWS National Hurricane Center Miami FL EP072017 200 AM PDT Fri Jul 21 2017
...GREG HEADING WEST WITH NO CHANGE IN STRENGTH...
SUMMARY OF 200 AM PDT...0900 UTC...INFORMATION ---------------------------------------------- LOCATION...14.5N 118.3W ABOUT 800 MI...1285 KM SW OF THE SOUTHERN TIP OF BAJA CALIFORNIA MAXIMUM SUSTAINED WINDS...50 MPH...85 KM/H PRESENT MOVEMENT...W OR 280 DEGREES AT 10 MPH...17 KM/H MINIMUM CENTRAL PRESSURE...1003 MB...29.62 INCHES
WATCHES AND WARNINGS -------------------- There are no coastal watches or warnings in effect.
DISCUSSION AND 48-HOUR OUTLOOK ------------------------------ At 200 AM PDT (0900 UTC), the center of Tropical Storm Greg was located near latitude 14.5 North, longitude 118.3 West. Greg is moving toward the west near 10 mph (17 km/h). A continued westward to west-northwestward motion with a slight increase in forward speed is expected through the weekend.
Maximum sustained winds are near 50 mph (85 km/h) with higher gusts. Some strengthening is forecast during the next 48 hours, and Greg is forecast to be near hurricane strength by Sunday.
Tropical-storm-force winds extend outward up to 60 miles (95 km) from the center.
The estimated minimum central pressure is 1003 mb (29.62 inches).
HAZARDS AFFECTING LAND ---------------------- None.
NEXT ADVISORY ------------- Next complete advisory at 800 AM PDT.
$$ Forecaster Zelinsky
NNNN
